dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Direct flights from Astana to Belgrade by the end of 2025—is this the start of a new travel corridor between Central Asia and the Balkans?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Direct flights from Astana to Belgrade by the end of twenty twenty five-is this the start of a new travel corridor between Central Asia and the Balkans?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The two sides explored the possibility of launching direct flights between Astana and Belgrade. Kazakh representatives from SCAT Airlines and travel agencies also took part in the talks, which focused on the potential launch of direct flights by the end of 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And it's SCAT Airlines that's expected to operate those flights, which is interesting because they're a Kazakh carrier but not always the first name you hear for international expansion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And it's S C A T Airlines that's expected to operate those flights, which is interesting because they're a Kazakh carrier but not always the first name you hear for international expansion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flights are expected to be operated by SCAT Airlines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they had Talgat Lastayev, the Vice Minister of Transport, involved in those talks with Serbia's minister, Aleksandra Sofronijevic. That's pretty serious government backing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they had Talgat Lastayev, the Vice Minister of Transport, involved in those talks with Serbia's minister, Aleksandra Sofronijevic. That's pretty serious government backing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Civil Aviation Committee of the Ministry of Transport confirmed that discussions were held between Kazakhstan's Vice Minister of Transport, Talgat Lastayev, and Serbia's Minister of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure, Aleksandra Sofronijevic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and it wasn't just transport officials—Ivana Rakic from Serbia's tourism ministry was there too, so they're clearly thinking about the travel and economic angle, not just logistics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and it wasn't just transport officials-Ivana Rakic from Serbia's tourism ministry was there too, so they're clearly thinking about the travel and economic angle, not just logistics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A separate meeting was also held with Serbia's Deputy Minister of Tourism and Youth, Ivana Rakic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like boosting tourism both ways. I mean, how many people do you think are actually gonna take that route?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like boosting tourism both ways. I mean, how many people do you think are actually gonna take that route?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, if it's direct, it could be a game-changer for business travelers and maybe even tourists looking for something off the beaten path. Plus, Kazakhstanis will soon have direct flights to Jordan too—seems like they're really expanding options.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, if it's direct, it could be a game-changer for business travelers and maybe even tourists looking for something off the beaten path. Plus, Kazakhstanis will soon have direct flights to Jordan too-seems like they're really expanding options.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis will also soon be able to travel directly to Jordan, as plans for a new international route are underway.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a good point. It feels like Kazakhstan is strategically opening up more air links. Do we know how frequent these Belgrade flights might be?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a good point. It feels like Kazakhstan is strategically opening up more air links. Do we know how frequent these Belgrade flights might be?

dialogue_turns.text: Not yet—Tengrinews.kz said they reached out to SCAT's press service for details, so we'll have to wait on that.

dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's exciting. I wonder if this is part of a bigger push to make Astana more of a hub.
